## createView() function

Create a view service for a given adapter and optional signal implementation

Combines the default view primitives (el, map, match, portal) with an adapter and signal system to create a complete view service.

**Signature:**

```typescript
createView: <TConfig extends AdapterConfig>({ adapter, signals, }: {
    adapter: Adapter<TConfig>;
    signals: Use<SignalsSvc>;
}) => Use<ViewSvc<TConfig>>
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

{ adapter, signals, }


</td><td>

{ adapter: [Adapter](../adapter/)<!-- -->&lt;TConfig&gt;; signals: [Use](../../lattice/use/)<!-- -->&lt;[SignalsSvc](../../signals/signalssvc/)<!-- -->&gt;; }


</td><td>


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[Use](../../lattice/use/)<!-- -->&lt;[ViewSvc](../viewsvc/)<!-- -->&lt;TConfig&gt;&gt;

## Example 1

With auto-created signals

```typescript
import { createView } from '@lattice/view/presets/core';
import { createDOMAdapter } from '@lattice/view/adapters/dom';

const adapter = createDOMAdapter();
const view = createView(adapter);

const { el, signal, computed } = view();
```

## Example 2

With shared signals (for islands/SSR)

```typescript
import { createView } from '@lattice/view/presets/core';
import { createDOMAdapter } from '@lattice/view/adapters/dom';
import { createSignals } from '@lattice/signals/presets/core';

const signals = createSignals()();
const adapter = createDOMAdapter();
const view = createView(adapter, signals);

const { el, map, match, portal } = view();
```
